intro: Crotalaria versicolor, commonly known as the variable crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow and purple flowers. The plant has palmately compound leaves and produces seed pods that split open when mature. It is often found in disturbed soils and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which benefits soil fertility. Crotalaria versicolor is also noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
